org.bonitasoft.engine.expression

Class ExpressionBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bonitasoft.engine.expression.ExpressionBuilder

  • public class ExpressionBuilder
extends Object
    Builds a new Expression. This class provides utility methods for building of different Expression types. Attributes Name and ReturnType must be set.
    Author:
    Feng Hui, Matthieu Chaffotte, Emmanuel Duchastenier, Celine Souchet

      • buildBusinessObjectDAOExpression

        public Expression buildBusinessObjectDAOExpression(String businessObjectDAOName,
                                          String daoInterfaceClassName)
                                            throws InvalidExpressionException
        Builds an Expression that evaluates to a Business Object Server DAO.
        Parameters:
        businessObjectDAOName - name of the DAO to evaluate.
        daoInterfaceClassName - class name of the interface of the DAO to instantiate.
        Returns:
        the newly created expression.
        Throws:
        InvalidExpressionException - if the expression cannot be built because it is invalid.

      • done

        public Expression done()
                throws InvalidExpressionException
        Builds a new expression with the specified attributes
        Returns:
        the newly built Expression
        Throws:
        InvalidExpressionException - is name or returnType is not set or set to an empty String.
        Since:
        6.0

public ExpressionBuilder setExpressionType(String expressionType)

      • setExpressionType

        public ExpressionBuilder setExpressionType(ExpressionType expressionType)
        Sets the type of this expression.
        Parameters:
        expressionType - the expression type to use.
        Returns:
        this ExpressionBuilder itself, for chain calls.
        See Also:
        ExpressionType

      • setReturnType

        public ExpressionBuilder setReturnType(String returnType)
                                throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the return type of the underlining expression.
        Parameters:
        returnType - the return type to set on the expression.
        Returns:
        this ExpressionBuilder itself.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the return type is a primitive type

      • createJavaMethodCallExpression

        public Expression createJavaMethodCallExpression(String name,
                                        String methodName,
                                        String returnType,
                                        Expression entityExpression)
                                          throws InvalidExpressionException
        Create an expression to call a simple Java method (without parameters)
        Parameters:
        name - the expression name
        methodName - the name of method to call
        returnType - the method return type
        entityExpression - the expression representing the entity (Java Object) where the method will be called
        Returns:
        the created expression
        Throws:
        InvalidExpressionException - if the created expression is invalid
        Since:
        6.0
